executive_summary: The Construction and Mining Equipment Wholesaling industry resells various construction and excavation machines that make many of the country's biggest infrastructure projects possible. Industry products are crucial to the construction and mining sectors, as the value of these industries are hard to access without large machinery. Demand for the construction and mining industries directly increases the demand for industry products. Over the past five years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 1.1% to $123.4 billion, including an expected 1.0% increase in 2023. Profit is expected to slump to 5.0% of revenue in 2023 from 5.2% in 2018.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Size of the Construction Sector and Rising Demand for Mining Have Expanded Industry Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The massive size of the Construction sector makes it one of the industry's most important revenue sources. Most construction projects require the purchase of tractors, graders, rollers and other equipment from wholesalers. The pandemic caused a massive drop in consumer confidence due to the high uncertainty regarding the economic future. This temporarily discouraged consumers from spending. Decreased consumer spending on tourism and social activities during the pandemic left extra income for home improvement projects. A spike in home improvements helped limit industry declines in 2020. The rise in demand for mining contributed to industry revenue gains as mining accounts for a significant market for operators. The mining sector requires industry products to extract minerals like coal, ores and crude petroleum.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand From the Mining Sector is Volatile
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mining activity has grown substantially over the past five years, boosting the need for mining machinery and equipment from wholesalers. Demand from mining plummeted during the pandemic, contributing to the fall in revenue for wholesalers of construction and mining equipment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DEMAND FROM THE CONSTRUCTION SECTOR IS EXPECTED TO CLIMB WHILE DEMAND FOR THE MINING SECTOR WILL SLUMP
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As conditions in the nonresidential construction market are set to improve, companies building offices, industrial plants, and infrastructure will drive investment in new machinery and equipment. Consumer spending and corporate profit are slated to rise, boosting the need for industry products as business, retail, and other private nonresidential construction activities expand. Demand from mining is projected to decline, adding downward pressure and limiting revenue gains.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EXPANDED INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT WILL STRENGTHEN REVENUE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Congress signed the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act worth hundreds of billions of dollars into law in 2021 with the goal of upgrading and modernizing US infrastructure. The value of utilities construction and government funding for highways are projected to rise, further raising the need for industry products.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry wholesale specialized machinery and equipment that is used in construction and mining operations. This industry does not include wholesalers of oil and natural gas machinery and equipment, which are included in the Industrial Machinery and Equipment Wholesaling industry (IBISWorld report 42383).

key_trends: The massive size of the Construction sector and its need for large equipment such as tractors, graders, and rollers to complete projects has driven demand.
Expanded infrastructure investment will fund construction projects across the country, boosting demand. Construction and mining equipment will be required for such large projects.

Environmental regulations concerning emissions from machinery can raise production costs, which means greater costs passed down to wholesalers. If wholesalers are not able to pass down costs to contractors, profit margins may be negatively influenced.
Trade associations can influence government relations and political action in the industry's favor. Lobbying support is hugely beneficial for wholesalers.
Since there are no significant changes in equipment over short periods of time, contractors choose to buy used or rent equipment to carry out projects at lower costs.
Parts are cost savers for contractors and can extend the useful life of the equipment in the long run.
Wholesalers position themselves close to regions that are industrial hubs.
Regions that are economically prosperous areas with high populations are a gold mine for wholesalers.
Exclusive distribution rights to a brand of equipment over a specific geographic locale can give wholesalers an advantage over competitors.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Construction and mining wholesalers offer various machinery and equipment for construction projects. Tractors, loaders, and power cranes are used in construction projects to move equipment and building materials within construction sites. Rollers and graders are used to flatten land during road construction and to level the ground so that a structure can be built on an ungraded piece of land.

Mining operations require heavy and expensive mining-specific machinery. The equipment that operators use depends on the type of mining operation being conducted. Strip mining, in which minerals (most commonly coal) are gathered along with the entire top layer of soil, make heavy use of draglines. Underground mining operations make use of continuous mining machines, which drill deeper into a mine simultaneously chipping and collecting minerals. Mining operations also use more generalized equipment used in construction projects, such as tractors, trucks, cranes, and bulldozers.

market_segmentation.segment: Businesses for use in own operation not for resale or production
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market is comprised of many businesses that use equipment that is primarily designed to be used in construction for other purposes. Loaders may be used by businesses that operate outdoors as a means of transporting goods or equipment across a property.
This market is comprised of farms that use equipment that is primarily designed to be used in construction for other purposes.

products_and_services.product_description: While tractors and loaders are the most commonly used types of construction equipment and machinery, many other types of machines are sold in smaller quantities. Wholesalers sell bulldozers as they are used to move large quantities of earth, rock, and other materials across construction, mining, and other sites.

Another cost-saving strategy downstream operators employ is extending the lifecycle of their equipment and machinery by purchasing replacement components and parts. This maintenance may extend the useful life of equipment and reduce costs for buyers in the long run. This product segment makes up the largest share of industry sales.

This segment is a collection of new construction and mining equipment wholesaled by operators. Products include: off-highway wheel and track-laying tractors, power cranes, draglines and shovels, mixers and pavers, shovel loaders, graders, rollers, off-highway trucks, other assorted mining machinery such as mining drilling rigs, mineral processors (which separate valuable minerals from their ores), ore crushers, washers, screeners, loaders.
This product segment includes much of the same machinery outlined in the new construction and mining equipment segment. To save costs, buyers can rent or lease equipment on an as-needed basis.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Construction Projects Comprise the Largest Market but Shrink Due to the Decline in the Value of Construction
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Construction and mining wholesalers offer various machinery and equipment for construction projects. Tractors, loaders and power cranes are used in construction projects to move equipment and building materials within construction sites. Rollers and graders are used to flatten land during road construction and to level the ground so that a structure can be built on an ungraded piece of land. Construction projects represent the largest market as a source of revenue however, this market has been hindered by the decline in the value of construction over the past five years.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: THE MINERS' MARKET CLIMBS AS DEMAND FOR MINING JUMPS

The equipment that operators use depends on the type of mining operation being conducted. Strip mining, in which minerals (most commonly coal) are gathered along with the entire top layer of soil, make heavy use of draglines. Underground mining operations make use of continuous mining machines, which drill deeper into a mine simultaneously chipping and collecting minerals. Mining operations also use more generalized equipment used in construction projects, such as tractors, trucks, cranes, and bulldozers. The mining market has grown over the past five years as demand for mining has jumped, boosting this market.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast accounts for the largest share of construction and mining equipment wholesalers. Florida is the largest host of industry operators in the Southeast.

Establishments are most often located in economically prosperous areas with high populations. California hosts the second largest amount of construction and mining equipment wholesalers across the country.
The Great Lakes hosts the third most wholesalers of construction and mining equipment. This region is known for being very industrial and favorable for wholesalers of these products.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Industry is Subject to Few Regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry is subject to few regulations. Operators require a standard wholesaler's license from the US Department of Revenue, while wholesalers that operate as retailers must also obtain a retail tax license. There are basic federal and state business regulations regarding occupational health and safety, wages and other regulations concerning the treatment and welfare of employees.

Operators are subject to environmental regulations set by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Regulations concerning machinery emission levels can be strict. These regulations generally raise production costs for construction and mining equipment manufacturers, costs which are often partially passed on to wholesalers. When increased purchase costs cannot be passed on to consumers, regulations such as these can indirectly influence profit margins.

basis_points.basis_title: Brand Awareness and Product Offerings Drive Growth
basis_points.basis_description: Major construction and mining equipment manufacturers typically give small wholesaling operations the right to distribute their products within a designated regional hub. Wholesalers benefit from offering popular and recognizable brand products.
Exclusive distribution rights to a brand of equipment over a specific geographic locale can give wholesalers an advantage over competitors.
Regional distributors solidify monopolies in their areas of operation and distribute specific brands of construction or mining equipment.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Location Helps Establish a Regional Market
concentration_points.concentration_description: Most wholesalers are regionally based distributors of specific brands of construction or mining equipment and machinery. Regional distributors solidify monopolies in their areas of operation. The location of wholesaler establishments is a critical form of internal competition.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases climb and remain the largest expense as operators must purchase expensive machinery.
Wages remain relatively steady as operators require salespeople and laborers to manage and organize inventories.
Profit lags due to the stickiness of wages over the past five years.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Labor costs are relatively high, since labor is required to manage equipment inventories, organize and transport shipments of goods and develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and buyers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Construction and Mining Sectors Contribute to Fluctuations in Revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Wholesalers in this industry buy and sell construction and mining equipment, industry sales are highly correlated with the fortunes of the construction and mining sectors, which are traditionally volatile.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Rise in Mining Sector Demand Limits Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The rise in demand in the mining sector has benefited wholesalers over the past years and has limited revenue volatility.
Wholesalers of construction and mining equipment suffered during the pandemic as mandatory lockdown measures put the industry and the economy at a standstill.

This product segment accounts for about one-quarter of industry sales.

FAQs.question: Do your company's sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for construction and mining equipment will follow the general business cycle.

FAQs.question: How has the COVID-19 pandemic impacted your company's revenue?
FAQs.answer: The COVID-19 pandemic weakened the overall economy.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one specific product segment or wholesale an array of products?
FAQs.answer: Specialized wholesalers may have a superior market reputation, increasing sales volumes.

FAQs.question: Is your company located close to key construction and mining markets?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers located close to upstream equipment manufacturers will exhibit reduced transportation and purchase costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to revenue volatility amid the COVID-19 pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers that enter into long-term supply contracts with upstream manufacturers will shield themselves from future revenue volatility.
